Description: An open vessel of coarse red siltware pottery, with a rounded base and near vertical sides, which rise to a rounded rim. There is a moulding around the exterior below the rim and also a shallow groove some 3cm lower. The base is perforated by a small hole, apparently part of the original design, since it is surrounded by a low rim. The vessel exhibits irregularities: the level of the rim varies and the profiles of the sides are not regular. The exterior bears substantial remains of a slip, which varies in colour from pink to pale cream.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Findspot 51, domestic buildings in the urban area to the east of the Saite enclosure (so-called "Camp"). (?)
Curator's comments: The Findspot number 51 has been scratched into the side.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 60 § 57, pl.xxxiv, 37.)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.94, p.96, p.98, p.107, p.194, pl.36, p.219, pl.61)
